website_summaries.verdict: The adjustable head and the impressive 9.2-foot extending pole make this a good option for users with taller trees or areas that are hard to reach.
pros: Not only does the pole's extended reach allow users to reach limbs that other models cannot but the adjustable head also allows them to place the saw at just the right angle to fit into smaller areas
This makes it a good tool for users with a lot of high limbs and tight spots
This model uses corded power and automatic chain lubrication technology, allowing users to work long periods of time without stopping for chain oiling or gas
cons: The motor isn't as powerful as some Sun Joe models, and users who need to cut through thicker limbs may have to struggle slightly with this model

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. This is an excellent tool
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. This is an excellent tool. Well engineered . Functioned perfectly. Cutting branches like butter. Even the color well picked-- florescent yellow . The design of the telescopic handle will put other pole cutter to shame . I love this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno

customer_reviews.title: This little chain saw is pretty cool. I rented a 40 foot boom to ...
customer_reviews.text: This little chain saw is pretty cool. I rented a 40 foot boom to fix my trees after Hurricane Irma ravaged my big oaks and bought htis a s aback to my chain saw. Ended up using it more than my chainsaw as most busted hanging limbs known as widow makers were just out of reach. It ran great alll day. Cuts really good. Only drawback is its a little heavy but I'm 62 and was able to use it over my head all day long for 2 days so not unbearable. That and you have to watch the bar oil as it uses alot of bar oil but all in all I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: raybo

customer_reviews.title: false description
customer_reviews.text: "extend its telescoping pole to gain up to 15 feet of overhead reach" very deceiving information when I read that I am reading that I am gaining 15 ft from my arm reach and height, but that is not the case, the unit itself fully extended is 8'-0" so they are assuming everyone is 7 ft tall including arm reach, I am not part of the product they are selling, they are selling an 8 ft extension chain saw not a 15 ft extension chainsawas they claim
customer_reviews.author: Larry V

customer_reviews.title: small branches only
customer_reviews.text: It only cuts through branches that are maybe 3/4” inch thick. Anything larger will cause the chain to come off and once that happens, no matter how you put it back or tighten it, it will no longer cut
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed !!
customer_reviews.text: Great tool !! Great price !! Very impressed with the ease of use . Used it to top some Aspens that I needed to cut down near the house !! It worked perfect ! So much easier than my regular pole saw !! Nice and light even when extended !! I would highly recommend this product !!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L. Whitehead

customer_reviews.title: Time will tell if this is a keeper...
customer_reviews.text: Practical and easy to use. I was disappointed that no bar/chain fluid came with it, not even a small "starter" amount, since it is required. The unit started off strong but the chain QUICKLY lost cutting effectiveness unlike the unit this was intended to replace. Within an hour of use, cutting through a soft wood limb was taking minutes of pressured cutting instead of seconds. I finally stopped trying to cut until got a new chain. Within one weekend, I am ordering $16 worth of parts for this $70 product. Time will tell if this is a keeper and I am not ordering any more SunJoe product until see how this goes.
customer_reviews.author: -P

customer_reviews.title: Worked great. Package was damaged.
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well for what I needed. Cut through some pretty thick branches with little issue. If you are having issues cutting check the chain. Probably on backwards. Saw is kinda heavy so it can be awkward to use when fully extended. When I received the saw the packaging was damaged. Was like the box was cut in half then re-taped. Product did not appear to be damaged. Assembly can be a little tricky. They package the bar and chain together and in the correct direction. However mine was not attached. Just look at picture on the bar. It shows the correct direction. Would have been nice if some oil was included. Overall happy with purchase and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quite useful.  A little awkward.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like this item. I'd buy it again. Gets me into places I ain't ever been able to reach before. Two knocks -1. it goes through oil a little faster than I expected, but not a big thing. 2. the saw end of the unit is on the heavy side and makes the unit as a whole unbalanced. I now know why one would buy this smaller unit (6.5hp), instead of the (heavier) 8hp model. Still, plenty of power to do the work. Just be prepared to take about 5-10 minutes to get used to the weight balance.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Zarowitz

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy.
customer_reviews.text: The slightest pressure and chain pops.... Or digs into the plastic and gets stuck. Sux to get out and then trying to cut the extra plastic hanging so chaon can run free. 5 min. Into using and chain pops.... Poor design with how chain holder sits... Needs to be trashed and gone back to the drawing boards.
customer_reviews.author: kyle fields

customer_reviews.title: Not that useful for palm trees
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to assemble and all instructions in the manual were clear. However, I would not recommend this saw if you are specifically buying it to trimpalm trees. This saw is heavy and it is much easier to cut the palm leaves with a regular mechanical pole saw. Perhaps this electric saw is useful for trimming branches of large trees but it is unsuitable for my needs for trimming palm trees because of the weight and cumbersome need for oil and long cables. Just use a regular old pole saw for palms.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Can get a bit heavy, but manageable
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to find a trimmer to cut the fruits and leaves of our fishtail trees and palm trees. I am female 5’7 and like to do the pruning myself. I had a hard time reaching the fruits with a regular clipper/chainsaw. This one is perfect. I put it together myself and tightens the blade. I even used it while standing on a ladder. I will say it can get heavy over time and it helps if you can rest it on the tree for a few seconds in between. It cut thru the fruits and palm leaves without any issues. I even used it to cut some smaller fishtails and it did a better job than our regular chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: dastyvee

customer_reviews.title: easy to put together and affordable
customer_reviews.text: easy to put together and easy to use. the chain tends to get loose very quickly to due the heat though. it gets heavy very quickly when you are cutting overhead. Some folks complained that the oil leaks but i think they are storing it in an upright position, causing the oil to leak down towards the grip. the Instructions say to empty the oil reserve after each use. I avoid the leaky oil issue by storing mine on the floor with the oil cap facing upward. no leaks and i don't have to refill as often.
customer_reviews.author: TiaNena

customer_reviews.title: Don't forget bar oil!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to trim the tree branches that endanger my power line coming into my house. $70+ a cup of bar oil was enough to save me hundreds of dollars dealing with a trimming company. I used it enough to need to sharpen the chain if that tells you anything, and I'm pretty happy with the performance. You'll want to make sure you're fairly strong, it's very awkward to wield since 90% of the weight is at the far end. This is far from industrial equipment, don't expect to start a business trimming trees and expect this unit to last more than a few jobs, its designed to be "disposable".
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Heavier than expected and really long.
customer_reviews.text: It might be decent, as I love their product's, but before putting it together, I tried holding the pole up like I was cutting. It was quite heavy for me and I couldn't imagine using it. It could be dangerous. I'm in my 60s and a strong athletic woman and do all my pruning myself. The pole is very long on arrival. It is awkward. It's packaged well, has good instructions with a lot of scary warnings, comes with oil. You have to assemble it by installing the chain yourself, which scared me. I sent it back cuz it really was too big. I'll look for something lighter.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: AWSOME!
customer_reviews.text: I have never used a chainsaw of any type. I got this to trim annoying branches from my neighbors trees that hang over the fence into my yard. It arrived. Easy to assemble, youtube video was GREAT. I practiced on some scrap wood in the yard. Then i chopped those annoying neighborly branches with ease. Totally awsome. You can also use it in a zombie apocalypse and socially distance with the 15 foot pole reach. That might work for socially distancing with your neighbors during a dispute about dying tree branches that hang over your fence. I LOVE THIS SAW..
customer_reviews.author: guitarmike82

customer_reviews.title: Do not cut even a 1 inch branch.
customer_reviews.text: The product looks nice but doesn't cut. I was trying to cut a 1inch branch and spent more than 15 minutes to do it!. I called a friend for help and he has the same problem. I really doubt than can cut 7inches branch as advertised. The blade is short and very difficult for cut. After 15 min holding the pole really start feeling heavier and heavier. My advise, don't waist your money in this. I returned mine, don't do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Gonzalez-Rimbau

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. Gets a little unwieldy once you have the pole fully extended but that’s to be expected. Easy to get the chain on and get going. Be sure to buy some chain oil. Had no problem cutting through thinner branches, the only issue was getting through the bark on the underside. Great value and plenty of power for smaller limbs.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper X

customer_reviews.title: Sun Joe gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to trim back a huge Spanish Olive tree that over several years had turned into the worlds largest bush. It went together with no problem, the reach it provides worked well for me. Not too heavy to maneuver. The chain blade was sharp and had no problem cutting 3-4 inch branches. This tool is the perfect complement to the electric powered chain saw that I use for bigger jobs. The chain saw is light, but not as suitable for cutting and trimming out of reach branches. The Sun Joe is safer and easier to manipulate in that situation. I'm very satisfied with the Sun Joe. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Andy G

customer_reviews.title: Works Great So Far
customer_reviews.text: Just received this product on the 26th and used this weekend. In comparison to others that I have used and handled I am extremely pleased at this point. Pros: Good price point, fast Prime delivery, easy assembly, *well built and functional, nice handle and easy to extend, very good reach at around 15ft, good job of pruning trees. Very good website for registration and product information. Cons: A little heavy, especially when extended but manageable. (No different than others) Would definitely buy again and looking at other products in their extensive line.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Fairly light and long and powerful
customer_reviews.text: Fairly light and long and powerful. This is great if you do not want to purchase a battery system or do not want a loud gas engine. The adjustable Pole is long enough to get you the most spots. Powerful enough to cut almost any branch not extremely light but not heavy. By purchasing this item you save yourself needing to hire a landscaper etc. so I can pay for itself after one use. The chain jumped off one time but it was easy to put back on. Make sure you buy chain bar oil.
customer_reviews.author: djtrob

customer_reviews.title: Very dangerous
customer_reviews.text: This product fell apart on me the first time I used it. The nut that hold the chain and bar assembly together is a hand tightened nut with a plastic covering it gave out and the cover fell off at which point the chain came flying backwards at me and my ten-year-old son . We only narrowly did not sustain significant injury to our faces this tool is very dangerous they provide you with a locking wrench that has no way of working DO NOT BUY THIS TOOL. Amazon refuses my return because it was over 30 days . If you value your life you will not buy this saw
customer_reviews.author: Marc S

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product. Even better than what appears on product page.
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable product! My first 30 minutes use more than paid for the product in terms of money saved compared to calling a tree pruning company. Very easy to assemble. Excellent instructions. Read carefully. Tight construction. And performance? Oh boy. Pummeled through much larger trunks than advertised. Amazing reach. Especially combined with a ladder. Even goes through harder wood easily. Light enough for home use. Very nice telescopic pole. Stable even with full extension. Clean electric!
customer_reviews.author: AIStud

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product.
customer_reviews.text: First day on the job pole broke near the handle, useless after that cause pole can't be extended anymore. Contacted costumer service 3 times, every single time had to explain again and again what happened and again and again had the same answer, "item has to be replace and you will be contacted by another agent for replacement". I was never contacted after that. Wasted my time and money. I strongly suggest you spend your money some place else. Ps: Have to say that amazon refunded my money after a 3 minutes call.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Mangual

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job
customer_reviews.text: I would buy again. I got the corded type because it was cheaper and I use a small generator in the dump bed of our ezgo to power it. 4 stars were due to aggravation putting the chain on and adjusting it the first time, and it's a little too heavy out on the end if you extend the pole way out. Plus side, it cuts great and should stay that way if the chain isn't allowed to touch the ground. It will put a lot of limbs and brush on the ground in a short time.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Leaking oil.
customer_reviews.text: Very powerfuland cut branches easy but head heavy if you have to reach high places. I only had a chance to use it once but at the storage if you leave it standing (vertical), it leaks all the oil and your storage will be a mess. So the next time you use, you need to refill the oil. I just fill it to the minimum level because I only need to cut a couple of branches. Some people commented that you drain the oil after each use which is totally not practical. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Great polesaw
customer_reviews.text: This is a great polesaw. So much so, this is my second - I literally wore the first one out over about a five year period. Very easy to use and maintain. Chains are readily available from a number of sources. I prefer the Oregon brand. This model with the adjustable head is much easier to use than the fixed head model. With the head at a slight angle, it is easier to extend the pole, step back from the branch, and cut from the top of the branch. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: c_croom

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for over 2 years and it's been working great. But their support is even better! I broke the pole by having it fully extended and then having it fall from a ladder on a sharp edge and cracked the pole in half (my fault). I emailed them to see if I could buy a replacement pole, but they said Sorry for the Inconvenience, we'll send you a whole new one! even though it was out of warranty for 5 months and it was my fault. Incredible! So they have a new customer for life now :-)
customer_reviews.author: D. Knorowski

customer_reviews.title: A++++++
customer_reviews.text: This thing is "all of that and the bag of chips". I needed to trim some branches to get ready for a new fence. Putting it together was EZ. Before I got started, I thought it wasn't gonna work that well, but to my surprise, you would think I had a gas powered chain saw. This thing has plenty of power and it takes care of branches easily. The biggest branches I had to get rid of was about the thickness of a soda can. Not a problem at all. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Bak9

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cutting, Well built, Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Most things these days are very cheaply built but this pole saw design looks like it was well thought out and the use of quality materials is obvious. I've just finished trimming a large tree outside and it works great and cuts quickly. The pole extends with a breeze, cord is easy to secure and the tilt of the blade helps as you're using gravity downward. A deal for the price. It matches the high reviews online. I took the time to make sure to carefully read the instructions and the right kind of lubricating oil. Takes just a few minutes to set up. Good to go!
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Knocked Out 10 Years of Undone Foundation Plant Pruning in 60-90 Minutes!
customer_reviews.text: Just finished using this awesome little pole saw to do some serious backyard pruning - a Wisteria that had gone wild and was starting to take over two trees, some old pine whorls, 2 long-neglected Azaleas & volunteer shrubs that had popped up in several areas basically about a decade of total foundation planting neglect from the previous owners. I'm a 5'3" woman, 53 years old with arthritis and I was able to knock out all this tangly mess in about 60-90 minutes with my new best spring/fall SunJoe pruning buddy! My husband was amazed how fast this job went using this tool. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Dead on Arrival
customer_reviews.text: I put it together, pressed the safety switch and the on switch. Nothing. It is dead. I plugged in another tool and it worked fine. Called the company. Sit and wait. They finally answer. They want me to register the thing before they replace it. So I go to their website and fill in all the information. Call again. Sit and wait. They finally answer and said a replacement is on its way. To be continued
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Westbury

customer_reviews.title: One of the most valuable yard tools I have.
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked really good. I got it for trimming tree limbs that I had trouble reaching, but then I saw on their website that it is good for cutting down brush as well, so I tried it. I was pleasantly surprised at well it did that! I never would have thought to use it for that. I am allergic to insect stings so I have to be very careful working in the yard. This allows me to cut bushes and brush down from a distance, so when I get into a nest, I am at a much safer distance. It is literally a life saver!
customer_reviews.author: Rick M

customer_reviews.title: Great product, works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Great product, works as advertised. Doesn't cut quite as fast as my similar size gas chain saw on larger branches, but not a big deal. Longer reach than others I looked at, seems very well made, very sturdy. One hint, get a small funnel to make it easier to add chain oil.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Brown

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for trimming branches
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived with minor shipping damage (it's packaged in a very long cardboard box), but works perfectly. Chain saw oil isn't provided (buy separately) and the saw needs about an ounce at every use (presumably it leaks somewhere during storage, but I haven't seen any oil drops). It's powerful enough to cut 4" branches, maybe more. Controlling it when fully extended is a bit harder, but manageable. Overall, a great improvement over a manual tool.
customer_reviews.author: Linux Administrator

customer_reviews.title: No Problems
customer_reviews.text: No problems except assembly. May not have read directions closely enough. Didn't realize you have to line up chains saw blade holder with the pin in frame on the screw adjustment so it kept jumping off the track. Then had blade on backwards. After all these issues were overcome it worked perfectly. It wasn't overly as heavy as some reviewers said and I'm 76 years old. Worked perfectly once I got it assembled properly. I also filled it with oil and haven't observed any oil leakage yet. So it cut right threw my palm tree branches or whatever they are called. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Zakada

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking to buy!
customer_reviews.text: My husband had been looking to buy a pole saw for a while. I saw this one and when I showed it to him, he liked the specs that were listed. He already had bought a Sun Joe electric chain saw and was very pleased with it. When it came, he immediately put it to use and absolutely loved the way it performed. It was the perfect height, the head was adjustable and cut through the overhanging tree branches with ease. For the money, this was a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: bratzyone

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tool for trimming trees
customer_reviews.text: i am a female - 66 yrs old, i purchased this in the winter and i was just able to use it. It did a wonderful job. I was able to assemble it myself, following the directions. I was able to reach branches at least 9ft above me. It's a bit heavy but not overly. I was able to make 2-3 cuts, then take it down and lhen a few min back at it. I love this little power tool and I will get much use out of it
customer_reviews.author: Linda Voris

customer_reviews.title: the angle adjustment on the cutter bar is great as you can position it more precisely on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Much lighter and easier to use than my old pole rope limb cutter. Cuts well, the angle adjustment on the cutter bar is great as you can position it more precisely on the branch you need to cut. It was easy to assemble and adjust the tension on the chain. Oiler works well on the chain. The pole extends smoothly and is stable at full length. Excellent choice for home use.
customer_reviews.author: Choco B

customer_reviews.title: Totally Impressed
customer_reviews.text: What use to take me two weeks every spring to prune my back yard "forest" with a manual pole saw and blade took me two hours with this electric. It reaches high enough to get your toughest pruning jobs done. Once those branches and limbs are down, shorten it up to cut them into manageable pieces. Adjusting pole length is a one finger, five second process. I would recommend this product to anyone. It doesn't come with bar and chain lube so be sure to get some before using and only use bar and chain lube if you want your chain to last.
customer_reviews.author: DoubleFault

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Handle When Fully Extended
customer_reviews.text: This pole saw does an excellent job of trimming limbs in our trees that we cannot otherwise reach. The only complaint I have about the pole saw is the weight of the unit when the pole is fully extended. I have back problems and the weight of the saw at the end of the pole makes it difficult to use for more than 30 minutes without my arms getting tired or my back hurting. The saw portion is well designed and does a very good job of cutting limbs up to about 7" even on our Blackjack trees that are difficult to cut with a regular chain saw. Overall I am pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mike the Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Leaks oil
customer_reviews.text: Oil reservoir has leaked from the first fill. The entire unit is always covered in oil, and must be refilled before every use. The oil gets on clothing, ladders, shoes and requires rubber gloves. Very annoying. Update 9/2020: Used the saw 6 or 7 times. Today the blade end housing came off, leaving the blade and the chain stuck in the cut on a tall limb. A very large, heavy limb is now half cut in a dangerous location. Be sure to keep the housing nut tight.
customer_reviews.author: ranger69

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for Cheap!
customer_reviews.text: This chain saw will pay for itself in its first use. I was able to cut a few dead branches and do some cleaning up to other nearby treas in under an hour. Basic TIPS from some one who just assembled and used: 1) Buy Bar & Chain oil along with this product as it will need it prior to use. 2) Read the instructions before cutting the zip ties (especially on the chain itself) 3) Read all instructions first prior to beginning assembly. 4) Follow all safety guidelines in the manual!
customer_reviews.author: Atuor

customer_reviews.title: Works great but hard to pour chain oil without spilling.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I've been cutting a lot of small trees. It's top heavy so you have to be strong to hold it. My main concern is that the chain oil is really hard to fill. I have to add it really slowly so an air pocket doesn't form and oil pours out. I've gotten a lot of use out of it and it's been about 3 months of using it every weekend for 1-3 hours of work.
customer_reviews.author: Poppin

customer_reviews.title: Works great and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Packaging came crushed and revealed like it was previously opened. All contents were luckily inside. Once assembled and filled with oil it worked perfectly. Used it to cut branches off a tree in my backyard. Also use it to trim other trees. Works great with low maintenance. I need to top off the oil after about 5 uses. For oil I use the Makita 181119-a Bar and Chain Oil Lubricant.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Wong

customer_reviews.title: Motor burnt out after just a dozen small branch cuts..  Disappointing customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I only used this on two occasions and cut nothing larger than 1 inch diameter branch. Second use the unit died after the first branch with a hot electrical burning smell. Further testing showed the motor rotor windings burnt out. Customer service said they would replace unit in 3-4 days. Shipped me just a replacement chain instead 8 days later. Now they're shipping a full unit. Lots of lost yard project time while I wait.
customer_reviews.author: midatlantian

customer_reviews.title: Compact Power
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to clear some tree limbs that were reaching over my house. I was amazed at how easy it was to us. Was able to cut through 6” limbs with ease. The reach was impressive too. Best bang for your buck when it comes to extendable chain saws.
customer_reviews.author: Gray

customer_reviews.title: Highly Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I was Skeptical to begin with but after reading the reviews I gave it a shot and I can only say that the Positive reviews Are accurate! it works great! very easy to use! and is not so heavy so you can extend it all the way out and it has great power too! I'm VERY Satisfied with this product as now I am also with ALL of SunJoe Products! can't go wrong with this pole saw! and price even makes it even MORE of a better deal! 5 Stars! AAAAA+++++
customer_reviews.author: Larry M.

customer_reviews.title: Most important thing to know is, be safe as you use this and it will get the job done.
customer_reviews.text: This works so well, cuts so fast, WoW made me wished I had this long time ago. One Very Important thing to think about is when using this not to be right under the thing you are cutting. A tree branch my not look that big on the tree, but in the air coming down it can hit really hard and you do not want it to hit you. The tool is no jock it cuts really fast and smooth. I had to get on a ladder to get to one branch, but I had to see which way it would fall so it would not knock me off the ladder I was on,( Very Important thing to know)
customer_reviews.author: Gary S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Pole saw..!!
customer_reviews.text: EASY TO ASSEMBLE. I REALLY LIKE THE BUTTON THAT MUST BE PUSHED TO START SAW AND PRESS TRIGGER . THE POWER CORD COMES ALOOSE EASILY. BUT THIS SAW DOES THE JOB. JUST CUT TREE LIMBS AND SHRUGS WITH SEVERAL BRANCHES. IT HAS SOME WEIGHT BUT I WAS ABLE TO HANDLE the saw. . HIGHLY RECOMMEND.
customer_reviews.author: GFS08

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: This is not a heavy-duty lumber-jack chain saw, but that's ok. That's not what I needed. It's light-duty and easy to use. The variable angle is great to keep the weight of the limb off the chain and it will handle up to a 6 or 7-inch limb with ease. The price is low as you are not having to buy an expensive battery. The use of an electrical cord can be cumbersome but it's a trade-off I was willing to take. Good product, great price.
customer_reviews.author: Honudad

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Maneuver But all these Pole Saws are
customer_reviews.text: It works quite well and is very powerful. Good quality. But understand that fully extended the heavy motor wt makes this a hand full to keep control of and use. But since that is the nature of this product no matter who the manufacturer it's just something to put up with for convenience of trimming stuff yourself. Overall a great product. But if you do not have strong arms this could be tough to use when extended a ways just be aware and be safe.
customer_reviews.author: David Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Sun Joe is my HERO again!
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase! - I watched a video posted in the reviews which made the assembly super Easy. Highly recommend this product to the tree trimming amateurs. Lightweight, easy pole adjustment and tilt feature made cutting super easy. As an older female, I was pleasantly surprised that I was able to trim 2 trees and clear out a brush area all in one day with ease. Again, I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the good price
customer_reviews.text: I needed to trim trees from around my yard and over my roof. I have never used a chainsaw or like tool, before and I am short, but the SunJoe SWJ802E 9 FT 6.5 Amp Electric Pole Chain Saw with Adjustable Head worked great, I was able to trim all my trees in a short time, it was easy to use and easy to assemble. My only issues were its a bit top heavy and some counterweight would be helpful on the backend, and the plug did not fit a standard extension cord though I made it work. Other then that, it was great.
customer_reviews.author: Soraya W. Malvaiz

customer_reviews.title: Good job, sharp chain
customer_reviews.text: Well, I will have to give this product 5 stars. You do need to install bar and chain upon arrival. It did the trick for several branches, one as large as 5" in diameter and saved me hundreds in calling out my tree guy. Good job, sharp chain, fairly easy to handle. You do have to have a strong grip when using it fully extended. The tilting head is a terrific idea. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: M. Wooten

customer_reviews.title: This is a best buy!
customer_reviews.text: I am so impressed with the quality and features of this pole saw! It is well designed and built. I trimmed two big oak trees as well as some pine trees and it performed perfectly. I cut through three-inch oak in about 3 seconds! Excellent manual and instructions on how to get the best from this saw. I'm a woodworker, so I like quality tools. I wish everything I bought was this good.
customer_reviews.author: M.E.M.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Easy enough to put together with the instructions provided. For $60 you really can’t go wrong. I needed to take a few low hanging branches down and calling a tree service out to do it would have been way more. A lot of reviews complain about not being provided with bar oil, but the handful of times your probably going to use this a bottle of Cain oil isn’t that much, could just use motor oil in a pinch. The oil tank it hard to see in low light.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: just a little off the top
customer_reviews.text: I rented a gas trimmer and after 2 hrs I had to return it as my arms were going to fall off. I was sore for days afterwards. This unit is lightweight and is easy to handle. It does a great job trimming branches thick and thin. The movable head is a godsend and the telescoping handle is icing on the cake.
customer_reviews.author: J. S. Ragman

customer_reviews.title: Tons of work out of this...
customer_reviews.text: Wish I would have taken a before and after picture of the work I have done with this 8" bladed pole saw. I'm normally an axe man, but had about 25 large trees to cut down in a short amount of time. Each tree range from 20-60 feet tall (averaging about 30 feet). This thing just kept cutting and cutting, I couldn't believe it! I thought for sure the motor was going to burn out or I was going to go through about 4-5 chains, but used the original chain for about 70% of it before I switched to a new one and finished the job! Awesome :)
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Good saw.
customer_reviews.text: The ranch hand has been using it for 4 hours now. Tired but the trees look like a gold course. Total time on the saw is about 20 hours and working great. Blade still sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a Champ
customer_reviews.text: Assembly went quickly with no problems. 10 minutes to complete with 2 of those being removing from the box and reading the instructions. I cut a branches for about 20 minutes and it did so easily. It went through a 5 inch branch easily, about 5 seconds. Had to re-tighten the chain after 5 cuts. Telescoping worked perfectly. Very happy with the saw and would recommend it to others. The only negative I have is that there is no place on the handle to store the wrench.
customer_reviews.author: R-Man

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful tool!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product. Perfect for light duty jobs. Very pleased with low weight, power available, and cost. Should have bought this years ago. Very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Carl M

customer_reviews.title: No chain oil included
customer_reviews.text: Annoying it doesn't come with chain oil but it needs it in order to operate. Title should I clude (cord not included) so I can buy one at the same time. Bummer. My pole also seemed used... But anyways this pole is bad ass. Took down a ton of big heavy brances and parts of the over grown trees we had.
customer_reviews.author: Kayte

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I am the envy of my friends. Being short and having tall bushes and trees is always an issue. Being older and without much body size means manual "loppers" require my full body weight to operate. This tool, used by myself and being asked for as a loan is surprisingly light weight although the blade assembly makes it just a bit top heavy. Well packaged to prevent incorrectly attaching the chain. Put on the chain, put in some oil, and whack away. It is just that easy.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Snyder

customer_reviews.title: It is a great tool, I recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: Okay, for the explanation of 4 stars instead of 5 stars, when I first used the saw, the chain that came with it wasn't very good. I went to my local hardware store and bought another chain, and once I had it installed, this thing cut through heavy branches like a hot knife through butter. I recommend this tool, it works great, extends out to get to branches you normally can't reach, and is easy to use. While you're waiting for it to ship, go to the store and buy 8 inch chain, so you're ready to go when it arrives.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Handle and Use
customer_reviews.text: Opened the box and read the assembly instructions and within 15 minutes, I was trimming my tree! The only thing you will need before using it is chain oil, which I already had. No problems with the operation of the unit, it easily sliced through 4" tree limbs just with its' own weight. Let gravity do the work! For the price, it's an excellent value! Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff from Sunny Florida

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and well built. A bit heavy with the pole fully extended but still easy to use. Installed the chain in reverse initially even with the provided instructions. But it's an easy fix. Have used it to cut branches 5 inches in diameter with no problems. Just make sure to keep the blade well oiled.
customer_reviews.author: Atsy

customer_reviews.title: This baby is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Wow am I pleased. So easy to assemble and use. I was able to cut much thicker branches than I imagined. If you order one, also order or buy a quart of Bar and Chair Oil. This is the only kind of oil that you can use. Don't hesitate to buy one, I can't believe how much money I saved. Our arborist wanted more than $500 to make all of the cuts I needed. I did for $70 and a day's worth of work.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, lots of power
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint is it gets heavy after a few branches on a ladder, but it's a mini chainsawon the end of a pole. It cuts great super sharp. Glad i bought it makes trimming much easier than with a manual non powered pole saw. The angle part is great for hard to reach spots, you can use iteather way.
customer_reviews.author: lizzy

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I am really impressed with this saw. I was looking at battery and gas powered ones for well over $100, I found this gem which is actually longer than the more expensive models. The saw cuts pine like a hot knife in butter. Very impressed. Only gripe is that it did not come with any chain oil. They could have included a little starter bottle or something.
customer_reviews.author: C.F.

customer_reviews.title: Does what is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: I used the pole saw to cut quite a few limbs on a couple trees. It works as advertised and got the job done. This is a light weight home pole saw, not a heavy duty commercial saw. It was easy to set up and is easy to adjust. As it is light weight, the pole is not the strongest material, but so far is sufficient for what I've used it for. Excellent value for the cost so far.
customer_reviews.author: C. Martin

customer_reviews.title: for the price it's worth it
customer_reviews.text: Not used yet but by the other reviews and videos I've seen about it, it must be good, for the price it's worth a gamble. The above was wrote before using: Now that I've used it I love it but it is very heavy when it is extended all the way out to 15 feet is why I gave it 3 stars. If it didn't cut as good as it does i would have gave less stars. It does cut very well and seems to be built very well.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Used and Defective
customer_reviews.text: Product came delivered used. Dirty and oily once I unscrewed the cover. Everything was zip tied together. I should have returned item once I discovered the condition of the product but I really wanted to saw down this 4.5 inch branch scraping against my roof. After about 15 minutes of trying to saw thru that log, it started smoking then stopped altogether. Considering all the good reviews, I must have received a defective pole saw. Return was fairly easy though.
customer_reviews.author: Hassan Huraibi

customer_reviews.title: Product was ok - but the protection plan if you get this
customer_reviews.text: I got this product. It works. My issue with this was the chain kept coming off. I would have to constantly put this back on. One day it slipped off and went into the plastic at the back of the saw and it was jammed in. When it worked, it was perfect, but when it acted up it was a real challenge. Get the insurance with this if you can just to cover your investment.
customer_reviews.author: Burns

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I trimmed trees professionally for a couple of years in my late teens. I always thought these trimmers were a gimmick for homeowners to waste there money on. After getting a few quotes on my palm trees, I decided to look for other options. This was on sale, and less than a quarter of the cost of the quotes I received. I was very surprised when I put this thing into action. Not only does it replace my manual pole saws, but I can also keep my gaffs in storage as well. Check out the before and after photos below.
customer_reviews.author: AARON

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised, this pole saw works really well! I had some limbs to trim away from the house and it made light work of all of them, a few we're over 5" in diameter. If your hesitant to get the angled or straight model, go with the angled one. It does NOT come with bar and chain oil, you NEED it, but it's cheap and a quart will last a long time. I used it only for about 5 hours, so can't speak to it's longevity, but it appears to be well made and I'd expect it to last for years
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Dead out of the box....
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this saw, but I never got the chance to use it. It was dead out of the box. I spent 2 hours troubleshooting it, with no luck. Although I never got to use the saw, other reviews were correct, it is unnecessary heavy for a 6.5 amp motor, and cheaply made. Back to amazon it goes.
customer_reviews.author: DeKalb Land Man

customer_reviews.title: NOPE NOPE NOPE
customer_reviews.text: I have quite a few Sun Joe products and have always been very happy. That is, until I bought this. Hands down, the worst product I have bought from them. This thing cuts through small branches like a dull butter knife. Don't waste your money nor your time. It to assemble and light weight but it doesn't CUT. AT ALL.
customer_reviews.author: darkskies

customer_reviews.title: Makes quick work of those haed to reach branches.
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp and cuts through branches with ease. It's a little tricky when fully extended but with a little practice you'll get the hang of it. Of course I violated one of the warning, not to use it while on a latter, sorry need to get to those hard to reach places and used atop od a 25' extension ladder. Just remember to account where the branches are going to fall. Works as advertised, pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Duane

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I had been experimenting with how to trim a no. of large oak limbs that were between eight and twelve feet off the ground with my chain saw for several years and could not find anyway that was really safe. I purchased this unit and in less than three hours I trimmed about 25 branches that I could not safety cut with the chain saw. With the pivot head, you can easily undercut a limb before cutting it through from the top----and stand on the ground out of the way of the falling limb while doing it. The unit worked very well. It is the best money I have spent on a simple tool in a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Miller

customer_reviews.title: Sun Joe pole saw is fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I had over grown tree limbs all over. I debated on whether to get a lithium pole saw. I read the reviews on the Sun Joe which were very favorable. The Sun Joe electric pole saw is awesome. It is handy. Well balanced. Sturdy and cut through limbs like butter. I looked for weeks for a pole saw I thought would provide the above characteristics. I'm writing this only to save time and money for other people who try to carefully vet products like I do.
customer_reviews.author: J P Moyer

customer_reviews.title: The Real Deal
customer_reviews.text: This saw is the real deal! Used it to trim low branches on 15 oaks and several ash trees. Good power through 8 inch branches. Motor on the end makes this a little heavy for prolonged use, but still very manageable and easy to maneuver within branches to pick out specific cuts. Now recommending to my neighbors on this tree lined street of 1 acre lots. Based on the engineering of this product, I bought the Sun Joe manual log splitter. I'm a fan. This company puts out good products and the splitter is over-engineered (what you want when crushing the logs.)
customer_reviews.author: Eagle 1

customer_reviews.title: I wish it could last longer....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw in 2017 and used less than 10 times (about 15 cuts) in backyard. Now the chain stops moving while the motor is running. If I adjusted the tightness of the chain then the motor stopped moving. It looks like the motor does not have enough power to drive the chain. It worked well for the first few cuts but now it is useless. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I'm not manly enough for these tools, but I'm glad I have it. It was a bit difficult putting the chain on and figuring out how to keep it on. It fell off a few times. The saw did what I needed, cutting hard to reach branches which would otherwise cost $100 perbranch to remove
customer_reviews.author: U2 Dan

customer_reviews.title: Cuts Tree Limbs Super Fast
customer_reviews.text: I put the chain on backwards but after I fixed that this thing went to town!! It zips through high branches like they don't exist. And big limbs too. Could take down trees I'm sure. Very sturdy, nice quality. Motor area is weighty but not too heavy. Glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: B.E. Goode

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for most trimming jobs
customer_reviews.text: The arborists in my area were coming back with 4-figure quotes to trim tree branches away from my house. This thing did the trick for $80. It sawed through moderate sized branches like butter, and it also cleanly clipped much smaller branches. Easy assembly The only thing I would note is that you need to buy chainsaw bar and chain oil and it needs a fairly hefty extension cord (12 or 14 gauge for 50-100ft). So make sure you have those on hand or order them with your saw.
customer_reviews.author: David McNitt

customer_reviews.title: It does the job and does it well
customer_reviews.text: It can extend to the length I need for most of cutting around my house. It does exactly what description states. Just remember to buy one of those chainsaw oils so you don't end up burning it. Just slight effort when you install saw chain. Overall A.
customer_reviews.author: XiaoMong Yang

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband for trimming our trees. When I showed him that the head part is adjustable he thought he wouldn't use it, but after trying it out he found that comes in very handy. Much easier to reach some of the branches. He is very impressed and likes it very much.
customer_reviews.author: Candi

customer_reviews.title: Incredible!
customer_reviews.text: Even after reading many positive reviews I did not expect much for this price point. It is simply incredible something this inexpensive works so well. I use it for trimming my mature trees. Not clear cutting a forest! Biggest diameter limb I have cut was 8" and using it the way the instructions outline the tool did not struggle one bit. Get the tool on top of the branch and let the weight of the tool and gravity do all the work. I would recommend this product to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: jay bartlett

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the cost
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t take much to put together. A little heavy and bulky at first but got easier with use. I let my daughter use it and she didn’t have any issues. I would make a recommendation to purchase this. Beats paying a lot for the big name brands. Can’t beat the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Richard McCracken

customer_reviews.title: Good Saw, but something cab be better
customer_reviews.text: I like the saw in general, especially the extension function when cutting high branches. I wish the chain would be made better. I used the chainsaw twice, the chain already lost its cutting ability. I contacted the manufacturer through its website and reported problem. Never got any reply.
customer_reviews.author: Sam W

customer_reviews.title: A must have for your yard
customer_reviews.text: Bought this at a great price on Deal Of The Day and so glad I did. No more getting up on a ladder with a chainsaw to trim tree limbs. There is no 2 stroke gas oil smell since it is electric which also makes it lighter. All you need is bar and chain oil and a 100 ft quality extension cord and you are cutting branches. I went through a 6” limb with very little effort. Great machine!
customer_reviews.author: JNick

customer_reviews.title: Cut above
customer_reviews.text: Had an area with a bush with 1 inch stocks that had been waiting for this tool. Put the blade on filled with chain oil and ran it for a hour and a half. It really did exactly what was needed. The ease of extending the pole, with its light weight made this tool perform above my expectation. Cord holder worked perfect. Chain adjustment easy, price and function hit 5 stars for me. Very happy with the Sun Joe.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Good product - does what it meant to do
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was easy - only two steps , just follow the instructions. The most critical - put chain in right direction (it's marked) and adjust tension. Be careful - chain is very sharp, use gloves Oil dripping - I think I solved it. Use thick oil and store saw "upside down" (oil cap down) Tried to use it - two 8" dry pine logs were cut through as butter (two cuts from opposite sides) Very long reach but relatively heavy - using it on the ladder would be a problem. You may want to use "pro" trick - belt or rope yourself to the ladder to give you more stability.
customer_reviews.author: oa

customer_reviews.title: Good Pole Saw
customer_reviews.text: This is a very handy outfit and you can really get to some high limbs. However, it is not light and once the pole is extended to its full length it is unwieldy. That being said, I am still glad I bought it as it does a good job of getting to some difficult limbs.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked 1 time. Then died out
customer_reviews.text: Needs better instructions on the unit. Worked well the first time (for maybe 30 minutes), then on the second attempt to use oil was all over the product. Then it stopped working. Also, The chain kept coming off on the 1st use. Bought a more reputable heavy duty brand/product. The concept of this product is great, however, which is why I gave it 2 stars
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Sun Joe Pole Monster
customer_reviews.text: This thing cuts amazing. It does leak chain oil so make sure you empty it or keep it upright. The metal base on mine broke while using it. I think it was cracked when I got it and I just didn't notice it. It shouldn't break that easy. I returned it to Amazon but I am going to order another one. Maybe I'll have better luck this time.
customer_reviews.author: awesome!!!ð   ð

customer_reviews.title: Heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy to handle if you don't have upper body strength (like me). Cuts pretty good for smaller 2-3 inch limbs. I would say price is great so not concerned about returning. I just have to break up the job for one tree over 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Julia B

customer_reviews.title: Good pole chain saw
customer_reviews.text: The unit comes almost fully assembled in a long box. You just need to attach the chain. Comes with the tools needed. Filled the oil reservoir, plugged it in and started cutting. Nothin like a sharp chain. Cuts like butter. Pole extends nicely. No issues. Seems like a good unit for the weekend warrior.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: I have made ease of use 5 star even though it is a little hard for me. A younger person wouldn't have any trouble with it. I am a 71 year old woman and when it is fully extended it is a little heave for me. It works really well.
customer_reviews.author: Lin

customer_reviews.title: Good Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Needed something that I could reach those pesky water sprouts (suckers) that plague my trees. This does the trick. Not too heavy to handle and feels solid. Good for small limb removal and trimming. I wouldn't use it for large limbs.
customer_reviews.author: D.C. in D.C.

product_meta.title: Sun Joe 8 inch 6.5 Amp Electric Pole Chain Saw with Adjustable Head, Grey
product_meta.description: Color:GreyLET GRAVITY DO THE WORK The Sun Joe SWJ802E pole chain saw takes the danger and difficulty out of trimming your overgrown trees. At only 7.9 lbs, the Sun Joe SWJ802E is super lightweight and easy to handle. Stand safely on solid ground and extend its telescoping pole to gain up to 15 feet of overhead reach. Powered by a 6.5-amp motor, the SWJ802E can handle the most stubborn tree limbs up to 7.5-inches thick. This pole chain saw features an 8-inch Oregon bar and chain with an auto-oiler to keep the bar and chain fully lubricated during use. Unique to SWJ802E is a multi-position adjustable head, which cuts from 0º to 30º angles. Unlike gas-powered tools, the Sun Joe pole saw is powered electrically, so you’ll reliably power up with the push of a button without having to deal with smoke, fumes, unpredictable starters or costly tune-ups. Plus, SWJ802E comes equipped with a built-in safety switch to prevent accidental starting. CSA- approved; Full two year warranty.
feature_bullets: Ideal for cutting overhanging limbs and thin logs
Telescoping pole extends to 9.4 ft providing up to 15 ft of overhead reach
Multi-position head cuts at 0, 15 and 30 angles
Powerful 6.5-amp motor cuts branches up to 7.5-Inch thick

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,574 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
